SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
EDUCATION DATA ARCHITECTURE (EDA) DOCUMENTATION
Get Oriented to the EDA Data Model

Understand the typical EDA data model for your institution.

Welcome to Your EDA Data Model Orientation
Start your Education Data Architecture (EDA) implementation with a solid understanding of the Salesforce data model for primary, secondary, and higher education.
Model Your Institutional Account Structure
Learn how to align the Account object in EDA to your institutional structure.
Model Your Physical Campus
Use the Facility object to model data about buildings, lab facilities, dormitories, sports facilities, and other property assets.
Model Faculty, Staff, and Student Contacts
Use the data stored in the Contact object and custom objects to understand your students, faculty, and staff.
Model Your Academic Calendar
Use the Term object to define and segment your institution's academic year.
Model Courses and Curricula
Use multiple custom objects in EDA to model your institution's courses and curricula.
Model Program Offerings
Model your institution's program offerings with the Program Plan and Plan Requirement objects.
Model Enrollments
Use the Program Enrollment and Affiliation objects to track a student's enrollments in academic and other programs.
Model Attendance
Track student attendance and participation with the Attendance Event object.
Model Student Grades
Use the Term Grade object to build out a high-level overview of student performance.
Model Certifications and Credentials
Keep track of an individual's achievements using the Academic Certification and Credential objects.
Model Behavior Management
Monitor student behavior with the Case, Contact, Behavior Involvement, and Behavior Response objects.
Model Suspects and Prospects
Identify and recruit the best-fit applicants for your institution.
Model Admissions Applications
Review and manage an applicant's information, education history, and qualifications.
